p: The group IB phospholipase A 2 gene has previously been associated to human obesity and diabetes [ 38] because of the catalytic activity of its encoded enzyme, which liberates lysophospholipids. The absorption of these lysophospholipids promotes insulin resistance and tissue lipid deposition [ 39]. It has also been reported that group IB phospholipase A 2 deficiency protects against high-carbohydrate diet-induced hyperlipidemia and obesity in mice [ 40]. Remarkably, the secretion of this enzyme predominantly during the gastrointestinal digestion suggests that oral administration of inhibitors may be a viable option for a potential therapy to suppress obesity and diabetes [ 41], hence the importance to discover new natural group IB PLA 2 inhibitors.
